titleStmt.title: A Brief dialogue between creditor & prisoner; clearly setting forth how both of them have been shamefully abused for many years: with a short and easie way to free all prisoners for debt, with a just care of all creditors; and fully satisfactory to all such who have any religion or morall honesty.

A Brief dialogue between creditor & prisoner; clearly setting forth how both of them have been shamefully abused for many years: with a short and easie way to free all prisoners for debt, with a just care of all creditors; and fully satisfactory to all such who have any religion or morall honesty.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Newcomb, dwelling in Thamestreet, over-against Baynards-Castle,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
